eu.trentorise.opendata.traceprov.dcat

Class AbstractDcatDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.trentorise.opendata.traceprov.dcat.AbstractDcatDistribution

  • @Value.Immutable
public abstract class AbstractDcatDistribution
extends Object
    Models a dcat:Distribution
    Author:
    David Leoni

    • Method Detail

      • getAccessURL

        @Value.Default
public String getAccessURL()
        A landing page, feed, SPARQL endpoint or other type of resource that gives access to the distribution of the dataset. Use this method, and not getDownloadURL(), when it is definitely not a download or when you are not sure whether it is. If the distribution(s) are accessible only through a landing page (i.e. direct download URLs are not known), then the link returned by containing dataset AbstractDcatDataset.getLandingPage() should be returned by this method, too. This field is specified by dcat:accessURL. For relation with AbstractDcatDataset.getLandingPage() see official dcat documentation

      • getByteSize

        @Value.Default
public int getByteSize()
        The size of a distribution in bytes, as specified by dcat:byteSize. The size in bytes can be approximated when the precise size is not known. When the size of the distribution is not known field must be set to 0 (this default value is not defined by DCAT standard).

      • getDatasetUri

        @Value.Default
public String getDatasetUri()
        Property not in Dcat standard, added for convenience. Result must be the same as containing dataset AbstractDcatDataset.getUri()

      • getDescription

        @Value.Default
public Dict getDescription()
        Free-text account of the distribution, as specified in dct:description

      • getDownloadURL

        @Value.Default
public String getDownloadURL()
        A file that contains the distribution of the dataset in a given format dcat:downloadURL is a specific form of dcat:accessURL (which is returned by getAccessURL(). Nevertheless, DCAT does not define dcat:downloadURL as a subproperty of dcat:accessURL not to enforce this entailment as DCAT profiles may wish to impose a stronger separation where they only use accessURL for non-download locations. i.e. dcat:downloadURL ; For relation with AbstractDcatDataset.getLandingPage() see official dcat documentation

      • getFormat

        @Value.Default
public String getFormat()
        The file format of the distribution, as specified in dct:format . getMediaType() SHOULD be used if the type of the distribution is defined by IANA.

      • getIssued

        public abstract com.google.common.base.Optional<org.joda.time.DateTime> getIssued()
        Date of formal issuance (e.g., publication) of the distribution. This property should be set using the first known date of issuance. Note DCAT standard requires dates in string format to be ISO 8601 Date and Time compliant string format i.e. "2011-12-11".
        See Also:
        getModified()

      • getLanguage

        @Value.Default
public Locale getLanguage()
        The language of the distribution. Note that this does not explicitly appear in the Distribution description in W3C Recommendation of 16 January 2014., but it's existence is indeed cited in the Dataset description (see AbstractDcatDataset.getLanguages()). So we made up the property and the description below to fill the gap. This overrides the value of the dataset and catalog language in case of conflict. The returned language should be also in the list of languages returned by the containing dataset AbstractDcatDataset.getLanguages() method. Java Locale should be created out of language codes as defined by the Library of Congress (ISO 639-1, ISO 639-2). If a ISO 639-1 (two-letter) code is defined for language, then its corresponding IRI should be used; if no ISO 639-1 code is defined, then IRI corresponding to the ISO 639-2 (three-letter) code should be used. If no locale is known Locale.ROOT must be used.

      • getLicense

        @Value.Default
public String getLicense()
        A link to the license document under which the distribution is made available. The license should be a legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource, as specified in dct:license
        See Also:
        getRights(), AbstractDcatCatalog.getLicense()

      • getMediaType

        @Value.Default
public String getMediaType()
        The media type of the distribution as defined by IANA , for example, "text/csv". This property SHOULD be used when the media type of the distribution is defined in IANA, otherwise dct:format MAY be used with different values. Property is specified by dcat:mediaType.

      • getModified

        public abstract com.google.common.base.Optional<org.joda.time.DateTime> getModified()
        Most recent date on which the distribution was changed, updated or modified. Note Dcat standard requires dates in string format to be ISO 8601 Date and Time compliant string format i.e. "2011-12-11".
        See Also:
        AbstractDcatDataset.getModified()

      • getRights

        @Value.Default
public String getRights()
        Information about rights held in and over the distribution, as specified by dct:rights dct:license as returned by getLicense() (which is also a sub-property of dct:rights), can be used to link a distribution to a license document. However, dct:rights returned by this method allow linking to a rights statement that can include licensing information as well as other information that supplements the licence such as attribution.
        See Also:
        getLicense(), AbstractDcatCatalog.getRights()

      • getTitle

        @Value.Default
public Dict getTitle()
        A human readable name given to the distribution, i.e. "CSV Distribution of Apple Production". Specified by dct:title

      • getUri

        @Value.Default
public String getUri()
        Returns the uri of the distribution (which is not the uri of the file pointed to).
        See Also:
        getDownloadURL(), getAccessURL()
